main event: On 9 August 1949, eight alleged flying discs were sighted over Hebgen Lake, Montana, with two reported crashes.
interesting points: Witness claimed the discs were approximately the size and shape of automobile tires., Two discs reportedly crashed: one in Hebgen Lake and one in the woods on the opposite shore., The discs were described as being metallic and grayish-white., Witness visibility was limited to five to ten seconds for the flying objects, with crashes visible for only two seconds., Extensive searches conducted post-sighting yielded no physical evidence of the reported discs.
witness description: The witness was an employee of a lodge who was considered trustworthy, yet tends to exaggerate.
